revised_title: The Origin and Cosmical Relations of Volcanic Energy
tldr: The author proposes a theory that explains volcanic heat as a result of the secular cooling of the Earth, which causes the Earth's solid crust to sink and crush, transforming the work into heat. This heat, combined with the access of water, leads to volcanic eruptions. The author also discusses the relationship between volcanic phenomena, seismic phenomena, and mountain elevation, and how these are all due to the play of one set of cosmical forces.
